verbose_text: Exercise is known to exert many effects on the hemostatic system, mainly through endothelial activation, which causes von Willebrand factor (VWF) and factor VIII (FVIII) elevation, platelet hyperreactivity, increased thrombin generation (TG) as well as elevated fibrinolytic markers.
evidence: FVIII) elevation, platelet hyperreactivity, increased thrombin
